standards: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining and drawing inferences.
Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem using details; summarize the text.
Describe a character, setting, or event in depth using specific details.
Explain major differences between poems, drama, and prose.
Compare and contrast the point of view from which different stories are narrated.
Determine the main idea and explain how it is supported by key details.
Explain events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in a text based on information in the text.
Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively and explain how it contributes to understanding.
Describe the overall structure of events, ideas, or concepts in a text.
Compare and contrast firsthand and secondhand accounts of the same event or topic.
Read grade-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression.
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding.
Write opinion pieces supporting a point of view with reasons and information.
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas clearly.
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences with descriptive details, clear event sequences, and character responses.
Engage effectively in collaborative discussions, building on othersâ€™ ideas and expressing own ideas clearly.
Paraphrase portions of a text read aloud or presented information.
Identify reasons and evidence a speaker provides to support points.
Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant details.
Add audio recordings and visual displays to enhance presentations.
Use relative pronouns and adverbs.
Form and use progressive verb tenses.
Use modal auxiliaries to convey various conditions.
Use correct capitalization, punctuation, and spelling.
Use context clues and Greek/Latin affixes and roots to determine meanings of words.
Consult reference materials to clarify word meanings and pronunciations.
